type.prompt:
Create a detailed architectural plan about how this repository is working. It has two main parts, one is procesing large amount of pdf files, chunk them up by questions, find similarity groups in order to do question deduplication, and it also has categorization feature to group questions into question categories. Other part is a vite application that's responsibility is to give visual representation of the questions. Go through all the existing codebase, keep in mind pdf and png files are dynamic content so no need to read them. I need a document that lets me recreate the whole functionality through agentic coding.

create the document in the repository in an md file

add a new category on the page called 'Latin' among all questions search for question text where text contains 'latin' in any regexp combination. List only those questions on this page. Validate it through chromemcp once validation is success commit and push changes to remote

add a new category on the page called 'Latin' among all questions search for question text where text contains 'latin' in any regexp combination. List only those questions on this page. Validate it through chromemcp once validation is success commit and push changes to remote
for the app server use a different port bc that is already in use on the machine, do this port change only for development time but not when you are pushing it to remote

in a separate worktree implement search input that is sticky and always visible on category pages where questions are listed, on user input filter rendered questions
for the app server use a different port bc that is already in use on the machine, do this port change only for development time but not when you are pushing it to remote
Merge loop clean-mint from branch ralph/clean-mint
